alert.note: Alert for Habersham; Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 5:12PM EDT until May 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Habersham County in northeastern Georgia... Rabun County in northeastern Georgia... Macon County in western North Carolina... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain has fallen over the past several hours and additional amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible this evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in localized areas. Area streams and rivers are rising with the Chattooga and Tallulah rivers continuing toward flood stage. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Franklin, Clayton, Clarkesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Highlands, Alto, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Tallulah Falls, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Lake Burton, Lakemont, Lake Rabun, Tallulah Gorge State Park and Nantahala Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
